feat.value: Upper right is vacat. Page number ⲥⲛⲅ visible upper right

Brakke notes that heading in slightly right-sloping script, with elaborate (but not colored) headband. At start of line 1 there is an asterisk, and thereafter a column of diples alternating with straight lines.
There are three lines of decoration separating the colophon from the incipit
Drawing of bird at bottom of page
Upper right has ⲥⲛⲇ Upper left is vacat
ⲉⲅⲁⲣⲑⲁⲣⲧⲟⲛ normalized to ⲉⲁⲕⲁⲣⲑⲁⲣⲧⲟⲛ (unclean) to match Brakke and Crislip translation
ⲩ corrected over ϥ (or vice versa?)
Upper left is vacat Upper right has ⲥⲛⲉ
ⲡⲉ is smeared but seems not to be a correction
possibly ⲉⲉⲣ︦ (with a short stroke or point over ⲣ)
Upper left has ⲥⲛⲋ. Middle has ⲓ︤ⲥ︥ ornament ⲭ︤ⲥ︥ Right has ⲓⲋ
There is a large splotch where both Zoega and Amélineau read ⲛⲛ at the beginning of the line before ⲣⲉϥⲣⲛⲟⲃⲉ, but there is no trace of ink there
second ⲟ corr. from ϥ (i.e. ⲉⲣⲟϥ corr. to ⲉⲣⲟⲟⲩ)
ⲧⲉ i.e ⲇⲉ; ⲙ corr. from ϩ
